frame.name: Level_of_light
frame.definition:
<def-root>There is a gradable amount of light in a particular <fen>Location</fen>. In some cases the <fen>Source</fen> of light may be indicated instead of the <fen>Location</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex>The small print was bearly readable by the light of the <fex name="Deg">very</fex> <t>dim</t> <fex name="Source">torch</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex> <ex>Tal flew over the barrier and into the <t>dark</t> <fex name="Loc">tunnel</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex>
The negetive LUs in this frame can be used metaphorically to describe time periods which can be characterized as bad or lacking in awareness, as shown in the following examples: <ex></ex> <ex>The custody of the era brought about a <t>dark</t> <fex name="Loc">period during which the written word was forgotten and art had disappeared</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex> <ex>Clinton is shrewd to solidify political support during these <t>dark</t> <fex name="Loc">days</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place whose amout of light is being described. The <fen>Location</fen> can also be a location in time, as seen in the second example below:
<ex>She hid from the man in a <t>dark</t> <fex name="Loc">corner</fex>.</ex>
<ex>We set off on our journey on a <t>dark</t> <fex name="Loc">night</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity from which the light eminates.
<ex>A <t>dim</t> <fex name="Source">lamp</fex> swung over the entrance to the castle.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The degree of the amount of light.
<ex>The room was <fex name="Deg">totally</fex> <t>dark</t>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characteristic of the level of light not covered by a more specific frame element.
<ex>The hall was <fex name="Descriptor">unusually</fex> <t>dark</t> when she stepped out of the apartment.</ex></def-root>
